author: Erik Siebert
title: IdeaScale Improvements
description: Obstacles prevent Fund Proposers from expressing themselves in the Cardano community and Community Advisors from reviewing proposals.

assessments.note: The problems or "obstacles" mentioned are not not described in the appropriate fields (e.g.  in "Describe the solution to your problem"), but became clear in the plan. This proposal addresses the challenge, but i don't see it as a crucial step. I would have liked to see a proposal to offers a continuous way to improve IdeaScale platform based on feedback rather then this "one" time fix that is proposed.

While reviewing this proposal, I was hoping for an indicator of how many times this proposal has been reviewed by my peers. While I have never submitted a proposal myself, I fully support markdown and agree that this would improve the experience of creating/editing proposals.

The problem and the solution described are reasonable and are within the scope of the challenge, but the proposed improvements are extremely simple (tool for text editing and minor adjustments to the website UI), which doesn't show great chances of impact and improvement in decision making. It is important to note that the Catalyst community for several weeks discussed several ideas for improvements to the IdeaScale, a poll was realized between members of the community and a list of suggestions was defined and forwarded to the IdeaScale team. Only part of these suggestions were included in the proposal, which reduces the potential for positive impact of the proposal.
Whilst these improvements will enhance the process, they seem marginal.
The proposal address the current challenge being faced by the proposers.
Why are we paying the company that IOHK is already paying to improve their platform? this feels like a poor allocation of Catalyst funds.

Although this project is essential to improve the platform itself, I do not think that it will improve the decision making. It will make the editing and browsing easier, but this don't necessarily improve the quality of reviews and decision making.
Other than that, it's impressive that you are charging $10K of a client to make some easy changes in the platform which will benefit not only Cardano, but every client.

This proposal is a little confusing to assess, despite the validity of the challenge presented. As a CA, I can clearly see the benefits of the solutions being proposed in terms of Ideascale reconfiguration to assist my peers and proposers, however, I am of the understanding that ideascale is just a product utilised by more than just IOHK's Project Catalyst hence any enhancements to its functionality is a cost that should be carried by ideascale themselves or by all its customers, not by the treasury of IOHK.

This proposal does address the challenge with the regard to actually improving the ideascale website. However, this proposal does not grow the community, but instead locks us with one specific vendor.

If IdeaScale shall remain being THE ideation-tool for the CATALYST Community, a quick reaction to community feedback and quick Improvement-cycles are crucial. Therefore it is great to see IdeaScale starting to participate in the CATALYST proposal process themselves! What keeps me from rating this with a (5) is the static list of improvements in this proposal (which I understand out of pragmatic reasons). I would prefer to keep a community-experts-prioritized, more dynamic  improvements-backlog and tackling always the highest priority items in such proposal (of course the content of the proposal must be sufficiently described also in this approach). Maybe this is already existing, but then the proposers missed to provide a link to such a transparent backlog.

This proposal would help out in the immediate to help make IdeaScale a much more manageable approach to handling the proposals and subsequent assessments for all users.  Enhancing the browser and community advisor tools will make it much easier to navigate and assess.

It wasn't clear to me at first that this proposal came from the IdeaScale team. The 3 proposed changes are well described and i'm confident that the team can implement this, but it would still be nice to see what resources are required for this (e.g. hours of work) and a budget breakdown to understand what the requested funds are being used for.
Who's better equipped than Ideascale to implement changes to Ideascale?

The proposers are responsible for the IdeaScale platform (website) and are known to the Cardano community, they have the capacity to execute the proposal, but have failed to describe details of their experiences in the proposal, which is an important factor and must be required for all proposals, to guarantee equality of conditions in the dispute and transparency, even if the proposers are well-known figures of the community.

Three improvements have been proposed that can improve decision-making. Despite the simplicity of the changes proposed for IdeaScale, there is no detailed execution plan, and in addition the lack of a detailed budget is a negative point. A criticism was made in the comments of the proposal in relation to the requested budget to be high for the proposed modifications and this criticism was not answered by the team.

There is no timeline.

I recommend that the team reassess the needs that have been presented by members of the Catalyst community and incorporate them into the proposal. In addition, it is important that the plan is better detailed, because despite the simplicity of the proposed changes, it is necessary to provide information on the timeline for these implementations and budget details.

I also noticed the team's lack of participation in the comments, which is a negative point.
The plan is simple and well detailed and the team should have no problem implementing it.
The team which is running the current site will be able to make this modification.
The plan presented is minimal and also again not clear what the timeline for delivery is.
The budget is not clearly outlined and it seems to be bigger than it should.

There is no doubt given this is an ideascale-drafted proposal that the itemised enhancements proposed could be successfully implemented after all they are responsible for the entire platform. This assessment and the rating granted is moot simply because it is ideascale who presented the enhancements and should be responsible for making the user-requested changes within their own budget.

From the experience presented, it is not clear how successful will the implementation be.  From how the ideascale looks like, it is far from professional. Also, this proposal makes it clear that the proposer themselves are not capable of fixing something a lot of people would call a must have feature in the first place. IdeaScale is stuck in the past.

Well, the proposer is IdeaScale. I have no doubt that IdeaScale's development team is well-suited to make these improvements successful. I am rating this with (5), even though a bit more precise 'definition of done' and a bit more background info about how this fits into IdeaScales overall release-planning would have been helpful. I am furthermore still lacking answers to questions raised during the feedback-phase: How were/are improvements of IdeaScale funded until now ? What is IOHK and/or the Foundation paying to IdeaScale. Is this something extra, or will that be our new future way of handlIng IdeaScale improvements ? Will we therefore see such proposals repetitively ?

This proposal seems feasible coming from the Ideascale community since this is their platform and they want to help improve it with funding.  Additional guidance may be needed to ensure that the changes are in the best interest of the community and maximize the potential of the proposed changes.  The funding amount seems reasonable since the cost would be to make slight changes with the UI/UX and no major redesigns appear to be needed.

A roadmap with milestones is not presented, so it will be difficult to follow the progress of this proposal. There are also no metrics of success, these could be based on feedback provided by users as changes are implemented.
An approximate timeline would have made this proposal even stronger.

The proposal addresses the challenge, but lacks some information to indicate its auditability, such as details on budget allocation, timeline, metrics / KPIs and details on the experience and skills of the proposers.

Although the IdeaScale team has a great reputation, we need tangible aspects to audit the performance of the proposal, otherwise the evaluation is based only on trust.
The proposal is feasible. It is not well detailed how these modifications meet meet the challenge.
Based on the credentials that Ideascale is hosting Catalyst. It is almost certain that the proposal will be implemented.
This is not the point of the Catalyst distributed decision making round, Ideascale is already under contract with IOHK, the community should not need to pay for basic platform improvements.

Anyone who logs in and uses ideascale's Project Catalyst community would be able to essentially perform an audit of the works as they are deployed. We afterall live in this space in the performance of our roles and duties. And I would reiterate the fact that there is no doubt ideascale can deploy the enhancements presented. The neutral rating given to this proposal can be attributed to my initial confusion in terms of dipping into IOHK's treasury to fund enhancements to a platform that it merely uses. I would go so far as to say, IOHK should find another platform to conduct its Project Catalyst activities if ideascale cannot enhance its own product and paying for it themselves.
It is not clear from the proposal how the funds are going to be used and what the licenses of the changes funded by the community will be.

I am giving here some special credits to the IdeaScale team. Any other proposer would get a 2 or 3 ranking from me, since - besides the description of the proposed improvements and the total costs - there is not much auditable information added. Knowing that IdeaScale is a professionally working company and knowing that the good relationship with our CATALYST community is very important to them, I accept that we can apply very rudimentary auditing in this case. For future proposals it would nevertheless be very helpful to be more transparent (So that we can be sure that CATALYST proposals are funding specific CATALYST improvements, and are NOT a way to finance general improvements of IdeaScale).
Roadmap and timeline of deliverables would be a nice thing to have to ensure that there is a project plan in place to implement the changes.  The ability to make this visi

solution: We are proposing making improvements to the IdeaScale platform will allow the Cardano community to make better decisions.
experience: Over the last 11 years IdeaScale has served over 10,000 communities from large enterprises to SMBs.
